messages.content: What is the purpose of the comfyui-lama-remover node in ComfyUI?
The comfyui-lama-remover node is a simple ComfyUI node used to remove items from an image using a mask.
How can you install the comfyui-lama-remover node in ComfyUI?
To install the comfyui-lama-remover node, navigate to the '/ComfyUI/custom_nodes/' folder and run 'git clone https://github.com/Layer-norm/comfyui-lama-remover.git'. Then, restart ComfyUI.
What should you do if a download error occurs during the installation of the comfyui-lama-remover node?
If a download error occurs, manually download the big-lama.pt model from the provided link and place it in the '/ComfyUI/custom_nodes/comfyui-lama-remover/ckpts/' folder.
ComfyUI is a powerful and modular stable diffusion GUI and backend.
LaMa is a resolution-robust large mask inpainting technique with Fourier Convolutions, as described in the paper 'Resolution-robust Large Mask Inpainting with Fourier Convolutions'.
Simple-lama-inpainting is a simple pip package for LaMa inpainting.
Lama-cleaner is a free and open-source inpainting tool powered by state-of-the-art AI models.
